position.marginalia_text: Primu[m] ergo principium naturale, est materia, seu causa materialis terra[e] aqua[e], Ignis & Aeris, sub Nutu Dei, vel Marthek: quod gra[e]cè neusi theu dicitur. & Hebrairè recon heloim, positis in literis & numeris: notatis per linea[m] perpendiculare[m], vt infra: ac diuisis p[er] a[e]quales et ina[e]quales partes, tali videlicet modo

marginalia.translation: Therefore, the prime natural principle is matter or the material cases soil, water, fire and air, under God's will or [Marthek], which is in Greek [neusi theu] and in Hebrew [rec on heloim], possibly in words and numbers. Note through the line of the plummet, as below, and divided in equal and unequal parts, in such evident way.
